items.name: LiveDocs
items.smallText: Real-time document collaboration with Google auth, live editing, comments, and smart notifications.
bigText: LiveDocs is a real-time collaborative document editor built with modern technologies such as Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. The project demonstrates the ability to create scalable, interactive web applications with a clean codebase and a focus on user experience.

The application supports secure authentication via Google (using NextAuth), allowing users to sign in and manage their sessions safely. Users can create, edit, delete, and share documents with view or edit permissions. All documents are autosaved and accessible from the main page.

LiveDocs includes a real-time collaborative text editor, enabling multiple users to edit the same document simultaneously. It supports both inline and general comments with threaded replies for effective communication.
Active collaborators are displayed in real time, enhancing collaboration. Users receive notifications for comments, shared documents, and collaborator activity.
The app is fully responsive, works seamlessly across all devices, and is built with reusable components and a modular architecture.
